an5.61:1: "Bhikkhus, these five perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are of great fruit and benefit, culminating in the deathless, having the deathless as their consummation. What five? The perception of unattractiveness, the perception of death, the perception of danger, the perception of the repulsiveness of food, and the perception of non-delight in the entire world.[n.066] The perception of unattractiveness(asubhasaññā)is explained atAN0.60§3; the perception of death, or mindfulness of death(maraṇasaññā,maraṇassati), atAN6.9–20 andAN8.73–74; the perception of danger(ādīnavasaññā), atAN0.60§4; the perception of the repulsiveness of food(āhāre paṭikkūlasaññā), atVism34–47, Ppn .–26; and the perception of non-delight in the entire world(sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā), atAN0.60§8.These five perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are of great fruit and benefit, culminating in the deathless, having the deathless as their consummation."
